content:
The std::mem::replace() and std::mem::take() methods are quite handy when interacting with boxes. In my opinion, we could extend the API to make things more comfortable to use.

This idea was suggested ~5 years ago and rejected (https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/23309). Perhaps it could be re-considered?
they'd need to be associated functions, and Box::replace(&mut b, val) doesn't seem any obviously better than replace(&mut b, val)
Ah that makes sense. I agree that there's no obvious benefit there. I was hoping that it would be possible to align the APIs of Cell and Box slightly.
